In the north there is a mountain called Jianta Moheshu.
There is a ghost king named Moli Yinli who resides there.
He has four brothers.
What are the four?

Andani, Yanmani, Umani, Muhani, Andani, causing the thief's eyes to go blind, Muhani, causing the thief to stay, Umani, causing the thief to sit, Muhani, causing the thief to become foolish, foolishness like this, Oulali, Wulali, Dandi-cha, Paduma, Chakali, causing the thief's mouth and teeth to chatter, until the thread is untied, then he will be released. Having recited this spell,
he then says, I do this for so-and-so and several others.
I make protective measures to ward off evil harm, causing all to attain peace and security.
When first chanting this sutra,
one should use the twenty-ninth day of the month.
In front of the Buddha, light seven lamps and burn
frankincense, scatter flowers and recite this spell seven times, and also
recite the spell for the benefit of the ghost king Meruluo, causing him to attain blessings and virtues.
Also light lamps, burn incense, and scatter flowers for the Ghost Mother, and light seven lamps, burn incense, and scatter flowers for her as well.
After reciting this sutra seven times,
the spell will then tell you to say this:
May it be so, as you wish.
